text:
Here we explore [[Help]] for DocumentDrivenDesign of software project. Our aim is to use TiddlyWiki as our document format of record, and then explore how we can socialise this work using FedWiki and other tools. In particular we wish to explore the use of LocalIntelligence in the authoring process.

{{$:/plugins/nico/projectify/ui/dashboard/Dashboard}}
title: About

text:
> How should we use FedWiki, and when should we use TiddlyWiki?

Currenlty we use federated wiki for social writing and teh archiving of content where forking is especially useful, and we use TiddlyWiki where complex and detailed data structures are best simplified and wrapped in a single file - for instance describing the functionality of a menu. We need to dig into this distinction in more detail.
title: FedWiki

text: When we need help we call for a [[Guide]]. Our initial focus might be software, but we seek to explore the use of TiddlyGuide's in the context of taking any form of action, either at the individual or the group / collective level.
title: Help

text: There is a need to get help for menu-items and menus as the complexity of projects results in many tools being created in many versions and it not being clear which one is the latest. Documentation can help with this as long as a documented menu-item named the same as an alternative version is distinguished => menu-item + menu-title is unique. As these map to a controller this should be possibe, and each controller has its own TiddlyWiki.
title: Menu Help

text: A menubar is represented by a MenuTable. A MenuTable is mainly a list on MenuTitle's. This implies a need to link between TiddlyWiki's.
title: Menubar Help
